intro.title: General Strike 100
intro.paragraph1: National museums, libraries, archives, community groups, and individuals across the UK are marking the centenary of the 1926 General Strike.
intro.paragraph2: This map brings together stories, exhibitions, and events to remember the strike and its impact on working people, as well as to highlight how these struggles connect to the present.
intro.partnershipText: In partnership with the trade union and wider labour movement, our project aims to develop an interactive map of sites for public visitation throughout 2026. This may include details of a specific exhibition, an educational event, or a unique collection to explore, all part of our rich history of the General Strike.
intro.passportText: Accompanying the interactive website, we plan to distribute a printed passport, encouraging public participation in visiting these sites and collecting stamps from each organisation they visit. This will provide discounts on related merchandise and foster a desire to visit as many sites as possible throughout the year.
